tool.name: Filter, normalize and preprocess multimodal data with muon

configfiles.configfile: import scanpy as sc import muon as mu mdata = mu.read_h5mu('$mudata_input') # if $method.method == 'filter_obs' mu.pp.filter_obs( mdata, var=$method.filter_obs_var ) # else if $method.method == 'filter_var' mu.pp.filter_var( mdata, var=$method.filter_var_var ) # else if $method.method == 'intersect_obs' mu.pp.intersect_obs( mdata, ) # else if $method.method == 'l2norm' mu.pp.l2norm( mdata, mod=$method.l2norm_mod, rep=$method.l2norm_rep, n_pcs=$method.l2norm_n_pcs ) #else mu.pp.neighbors( mdata, n_neighbors=$method.neighbors_n_neighbors, n_multineighbors=$method.neighbors_n_multineighbors, neighbor_keys=$method.neighbors_neighbor_keys, metric=$method.neighbors_metric, key_added=$method.neighbors_key_added, weight_key=$method.neighbors_weight_key, add_weights_to_modalities=$method.neighbors_add_weights_to_modalities, eps=$method.neighbors_eps ) mdata.write("mudata_with_preprocessing.h5mu")

param.name: mudata_input
param.label: MuData input file to run preprocessing
Method used for plotting
param.option: Filter: Filter observations (samples or cells) in-place using any column in .obs or in .X, using 'muon.pp.filter_obs'
Subset: Subset observations (samples or cells) in-place taking observations present only in all modalities, using 'muon.pp.intersect_obs'
Normalize: Normalize observations to unit L2 norm, using 'muon.pp.l2norm'
Search: Multimodal nearest neighbor search, using 'muon.pp.neighbors'

param.label: Column name in .obs or in .X to be used for filtering
Column name in .var or row name in .X to be used for filtering
Names of the modalities to normalize
The representation to normalize. X or any key for .obsm is valid, for all modalities
The number of principal components to use. This affects the result only if a PCA representation is being normalized
Number of nearest neighbors to find

Number of nearest neighbors in each modality to consider as candidates for multimodal nearest neighbors. Only points in the union of per-modality nearest neighbors are candidates for multimodal nearest neighbors. This will use the same metric that was used for the nearest neighbor search in the respective modality
Keys in .uns where per-modality neighborhood information is stored
Distance measure to use. This will only be used in the final step to search for nearest neighbors in the set of candidates
If specified, the neighbors data is added to .uns[key_added], distances are stored in .obsp[key_added + '_distances'] and connectivities in .obsp[key_added + '_connectivities']
Weight key to add to each modalityâ€™s .obs or to mdata.obs
If to add weights to individual modalities. By default, it is False and the weights will be added to mdata.obs
Small number to avoid numerical errors.

tool.help: **What it does** Import MuData from AnnData is a tool that allows creating a muon.MuData object out of two AnnData objects for multimodal omics factorial analysis. Furthermore, it runs pp.intersect_obs to keep only entries present in both modalities (AnnData objects) in the final MuData file.
